description: Application for a Minor Material Amendment (S73a) to vary condition 2 (Approved Plans) of planning permission ref: 191122FUL dated 14/08/2019 for: Part single, part two-storey and three storey extensions, refurbishment of the facade and conversion to seven flats, (studio, two x 1 bedroom and four x 2 bedroom) with associated refuse storage; cycle storage and communal roof garden. Variation seeks increase in height of the approved new build elements to accommodate acoustic insulation
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of Planning Permission ref. 191122FUL dated 14/08/2019.
REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, in the interest of proper planning.

| Details including samples of the materials and finishes to be used for all external surfaces of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced. The development shall be implemented only in accordance with these approved details, unless otherwise approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), Policy 7.4 and 7B of the Draft Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), Policies 7.4 - 7.6 of the London Plan (2016) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).
| Except as where indicated within the approved plans no part of the roof shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area.

Reason: To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 2.1 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4 & 7.6 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).

| The refuse and recycling storage facilities hereby approved as shown on plan A-52-001 Rev 1 shall be kept locked, and implemented and operational before the first occupation of any part of the development, and permanently retained thereafter.

Reason: In the interests of the adequate disposal, storage and collection of waste and recycling, in accordance with policies with policies 3.5 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), and policy 5.17 of the London Plan (2016).

| Prior to first occupation of the residential units hereby approved screening to all proposed balconies, terraces and private amenity areas shall be installed as indicated on the approved drawings and an obscured glass screen 1.7m high shall be installed to the communal terrace at roof level. This screening shall be fully implemented and retained permanently thereafter.

Reason:  To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties in accordance with Policies 7A, 7.4, and 7.B of the Development Management, Development Plan Document (2013); adopted Development (or Core) Strategy (April 2012); Policies 7.4, and 7.6 of the London Plan 2016 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).

| The cycle parking facilities hereby approved as shown on plan A-52-001 Rev 1 shall be implemented and operational before the first use of any part of the development hereby approved, and permanently retained thereafter, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The cycle parking shall be provided and located in a secure undercover and lockable compound.
Reason: To provide adequate bicycle storage to align with Sustainable Transport SPG and policy 6.9 and 6.13 of the London Plan (2016).

| Prior to commencement of the development, details shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing, of mitigation measures as recommended by HRS Services Ltd. in their Environmental Noise Report ref. 129614 - AC - 2v1 dated 3.7.2018 and of external noise levels from industrial/ commercial sources. Details shall include the sound insulation of the building envelope including glazing specifications (laboratory sound insulation including frames, seals and ventilators tested and approved in accordance with BS EN ISO 140-3: 1995 & BS EN ISO 10140-:2010) and of acoustically attenuated mechanical ventilation and cooling as necessary (with air intake from the cleanest aspect of the building) to achieve internal room- and (if provided) external amenity noise standards in accordance with the criteria of BS8233:2014. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: In the interests of the internal environment of the development and living conditions of future occupiers of the site, in accordance with policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies and 7.15 of the London Plan (2016), the National Planning Policy Framework (2012) and Interim guidance SPG 10 'Noise and Vibration'.

| Prior to commencement of the development, details shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing, of an enhanced sound insulation value of at least 5dB above the maximum Building Regulations value, for the floor/ceiling /wall structures separating different types of rooms/ uses in adjoining dwellings, namely, bed and living studio room above/adjoining bedroom/kitchen/living/dining room of separate dwelling, kitchen/living/dining/bathroom above/below bedroom of separate dwelling, communal amenity space above bedrooms. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: In the interests of the internal environment of the development and living conditions of future occupiers of the site, in accordance with policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies and 7.15 of the London Plan (2016), the National Planning Policy Framework (2012) and Interim guidance SPG 10 'Noise and Vibration'.

| Prior to commencement of the development, details shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing, of the sound insulation of the floor/ ceiling/ walls separating the commercial part(s) of the premises from dwellings. Details shall demonstrate that the sound insulation value is enhanced by at least 10-15dB above the Building Regulations value for residential use and, where necessary, additional mitigation measures are implemented to contain commercial noise within the commercial premises and to achieve the criteria of BS8233:2014 within the dwellings. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: In the interests of the internal environment of the development and living conditions of future occupiers of the site, in accordance with policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies and 7.15 of the London Plan (2016), the National Planning Policy Framework (2019) and Interim guidance SPG 10 'Noise and Vibration'.

| The external sound level emitted from plant, machinery or equipment at the development shall be lower than the lowest existing background sound level by at least 5dBA as measured at/ calculated to the nearest and/or most affected noise sensitive premises in order to prevent any adverse impact. The assessment shall be made in accordance with BS4142:2014, with all machinery operating together at maximum capacity. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: In the interests of the internal environment of the development and living conditions of future occupiers of the site, in accordance with policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies and 7.15 of the London Plan (2016), the National Planning Policy Framework (2019) and Interim guidance SPG 10 'Noise and Vibration'.

| Prior to occupation of the residential units hereby approved, machinery, plant or equipment/ extraction/ ventilation system and ducting at the development shall be mounted with proprietary anti-vibration isolators and fan motors shall be vibration isolated from the casing and adequately silenced and maintained as such.

Reason: In the interests of the internal environment of the development and living conditions of future occupiers of the site, in accordance with policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies and 7.15 of the London Plan (2016), the National Planning Policy Framework (2019) and Interim guidance SPG 10 'Noise and Vibration'.

| All boilers to serve the energy requirements of the development, including space heating and hot water to the flats, shall use Ultra-low NOx boilers with maximum NOx Emissions of under 0.030 g/kWh and be compliant with the NOx (g/m²) benchmarks as set out at Appendix 5 of the Mayor's Sustainable Design and Construction SPG. Such boilers shall be installed prior to first occupation of the development and thereafter shall be permanently retained.
Reason: In order to comply with Ealing Council's commitment to being an Air Quality Exemplar Borough and policy 7.14 of the London Plan (2016).
